page.title: 17Traditional song,'Old Ale'
page.content: When I was a little boy my father did say, You'd better go up Starve Acre,working today, I said I don't think I can go up there, I bain't feeling well, He said I know's what thee's want, 'tis a drop of old ale. Ale,ale,old English ale, served up in pewter and pink cups as well, some folks like radishes,some curly kale, So gi'e I baked parsnips, A girt dish o' taties, A lump o' fat bacon, And a drop of old ale.{ {-------------------------------------- bain't_am not thee's_you gi'e_give girt_great taties_potatoes
